docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Spurning the lead of the House, the Senate tonight voted against repealing a program providing expanded health benefits to 33 million Medicare beneficiaries. It then voted unanimously to scale back the plan significantly and eliminate the surtax that finances it.

headline.main: SENATE TRIMS BACK MEDICARE ADDITION AND KILLS SURTAX

byline.original: By MARTIN TOLCHIN, Special to The New York Times

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Every day 20 million Americans take pills to lower their blood pressure. And if some physicians had their way, most of the remaining 38 million Americans who have high blood pressure would be similarly medicated, taking one or more pills every day for the rest of their lives to ward off strokes, heart attacks and kidney disease.

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: ON A BRIGHT MID-SUMMER Wednesday, on the south side of Sunset Boulevard, off La Cienega, Arsenio Hall, the latest prince in the late-night realm where Johnny Carson is king, got a towering present: a billboard with a picture of him sprawled like a diva on a couch, smiling the smile of a Cheshire cat.
